column4: *-- Whenever I ran the Dapper graphical installer, the x server would not start, it did the same thing and went to a black screen. What could the problem be? --*
how are you installing? install CD during boot?
Im just using the install cd, and booting from the cd
is there any option not to use the graphical installer?
I got it installed with the not graphical installer, but now xserver wont start on bootup
this seems like a video problem.
I think thats what it isalso
what card are you using?
yep
I've reconfigured xorg
but I didn't really know which vid driver to select, I used the default i810
hmm. i was going to mention changing that. have you googled for what other people have done with that card?
btw, have you installed any linux on that machine and got x11 to work?
yeah
debian
why not just use the video card data from that install?
in xorg i mean
what do you mean
copy the xorg.conf (or whatever its called) to some place you can get to it again, and then apply those values to the new xorg.
unless you've already overwritten the Debian install...
yeah i did
Unfortunately
ahh. crap. im outta ideas. sorry
